name: lammps-elastic
title: Crystal Elastic Constants: Stiffness Tensor Calculation
description: LAMMPS simulation to compute the full elastic constant tensor for crystalline materials using finite deformation method with positive and negative strain displacements.
content:
Overview

This application computes the complete elastic constant tensor for crystalline materials using LAMMPS finite deformation method. The simulation applies small strain deformations in all six Voigt directions and measures the resulting stress changes to determine the full stiffness matrix.

Scientific Relevance

Elastic constants are fundamental material properties that describe the relationship between stress and strain in the linear elastic regime. They are crucial for understanding mechanical behavior, sound velocities, and thermodynamic properties of crystals. The finite deformation method provides accurate elastic constants by applying controlled strains and measuring stress responses, essential for materials design and validation of interatomic potentials.

Methodology

  • Deformation Method: Finite strain approach with positive/negative displacements

  • Voigt Notation: Six independent deformation components (1,2,3,4,5,6)

  • Energy Minimization: Full atomic relaxation after each deformation

  • Stress Calculation: Accurate stress tensor computation for stiffness matrix

System Configuration

  • Default System: Silicon crystal with Stillinger-Weber potential

  • Deformation Magnitude: Configurable strain amplitude (typically 0.01)

  • Minimization: Conjugate gradient with convergence criteria

  • Output: Complete 6x6 elastic stiffness matrix in GPa

Key Files

  • in.elastic: Main control script

  • init.mod: Crystal structure and deformation parameters

  • potential.mod: Interatomic potential definition

  • displace.mod: Deformation and stress calculation routines

Expected Results

For silicon with SW potential: C11≈150 GPa, C12≈65 GPa, C44≈80 GPa, providing benchmark values for cubic crystal elastic properties and validating simulation accuracy.
